docs.abstract: The president says shutting the border will punish Mexico, but economists say the economic damage to the United States would resemble the aftermath of a natural disaster.
docs.snippet: The president says shutting the border will punish Mexico, but economists say the economic damage to the United States would resemble the aftermath of a natural disaster.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It would most likely resemble the aftermath of a major natural disaster: food shortages, skyrocketing prices, people out of work and a plummeting stock market.

headline.main: Avocado Shortages and Price Spikes: How Trump’s Border Closing Would Hit U.S.
headline.print_headline: If the Mexican Border Is Closed, Expect Shortages and Price Spikes

docs.abstract: Amazon filed a motion saying the company was “justified in terminating its relationship with Allen.”
docs.snippet: Amazon filed a motion saying the company was “justified in terminating its relationship with Allen.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon Studios returned fire on Woody Allen on Wednesday, saying in a court filing that it was “justified in terminating” movie deals with the filmmaker and pointing to his public comments about the #MeToo movement as proof.

headline.main: Amazon Studios Counters Woody Allen’s Lawsuit and Defends Severing of Ties

docs.abstract: Sleek and convenient, Apple’s wireless earbuds are an engineering marvel. One problem: They are difficult and expensive to maintain.
docs.snippet: Sleek and convenient, Apple’s wireless earbuds are an engineering marvel. One problem: They are difficult and expensive to maintain.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple’s new AirPods, those tiny wireless earbuds that look like Q-Tips dangling from your ears, are some of the coolest audio accessories you can buy today.

headline.main: Apple AirPods Review: Perfect Earbuds, but They Don’t Last
headline.print_headline: The Perfect Earbuds, Except They Don’t Last

docs.abstract: David E. Sanger, a national security correspondent, recounts his gear from the computers in use when he joined The Times in 1982 to his overloaded backpack now.
docs.snippet: David E. Sanger, a national security correspondent, recounts his gear from the computers in use when he joined The Times in 1982 to his overloaded backpack now.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? David E. Sanger, a national security correspondent based in Washington, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: From Bubble Memory to Hot Spots and a Fly Rod
headline.print_headline: From Bubble Memory to Hot Spots and a Fly Rod

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: As a tight labor market raises costs, employers say the need for low-wage help can’t be met by the declining ranks of the native-born.
docs.snippet: As a tight labor market raises costs, employers say the need for low-wage help can’t be met by the declining ranks of the native-born.
docs.lead_paragraph: It takes Carlos Rojas two and a half to three hours to drive from his home in Stockton, Calif., to a job spreading plaster on houses going up in Campbell, on the southern rim of Silicon Valley. The trip is worth it, though. The 30-year-old immigrant from the Mexican state of Oaxaca says he makes roughly $25 an hour, depending on the job. That’s more than twice as much as Stockton’s farmworkers typically make in the fields. And his boss pays for gas.

headline.main: Short of Workers, U.S. Builders and Farmers Crave More Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Fat Paychecks, But Slim Hope Of Finding Help

docs.abstract: At least 25 prominent researchers are calling on the company to stop selling the technology to law enforcement agencies, citing concerns that it has built-in biases.
docs.snippet: At least 25 prominent researchers are calling on the company to stop selling the technology to law enforcement agencies, citing concerns that it has built-in biases.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — At least 25 prominent artificial-intelligence researchers, including experts at Google, Facebook, Microsoft and a recent winner of the prestigious Turing Award, have signed a letter calling on Amazon to stop selling its facial-recognition technology to law enforcement agencies because it is biased against women and people of color.

headline.main: A.I. Experts Question Amazon’s Facial-Recognition Technology
headline.print_headline: Amazon Asked to Limit Facial-Recognition Software

byline.original: By Cade Metz and Natasha Singer

docs.abstract: As in the Lion Air disaster, investigators believe an automated system on the doomed Ethiopian Airlines flight was set off by erroneous readings.
docs.snippet: As in the Lion Air disaster, investigators believe an automated system on the doomed Ethiopian Airlines flight was set off by erroneous readings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Black box data from a doomed Ethiopian Airlines flight suggests the crash was caused by a faulty sensor that erroneously activated an automated system on the Boeing 737 Max, a series of events suspected in an Indonesian disaster involving the same jet last year.

headline.main: In Ethiopia Crash, Faulty Sensor on Boeing 737 Max Is Suspected
headline.print_headline: Black Box Hints At Similar Cause Of Air Disasters

keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

byline.original: By James Glanz, Thomas Kaplan and Jack Nicas

docs.abstract: Airlines had to pay more for two optional upgrades that could warn pilots about sensor malfunctions. Boeing now plans to make one of the features standard.
docs.snippet: Airlines had to pay more for two optional upgrades that could warn pilots about sensor malfunctions. Boeing now plans to make one of the features standard.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the pilots of the doomed Boeing jets in Ethiopia and Indonesia fought to control their planes, they lacked two notable safety features in their cockpits.

headline.main: Doomed Boeing Jets Lacked 2 Safety Features That Company Sold Only as Extras

docs.abstract: Here’s why a system designed to stabilize the 737 Max may have caused two deadly crashes in five months.

docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s why a system designed to stabilize the 737 Max may have caused two deadly crashes in five months.

headline.main: The Dangerous Flaws in Boeing’s Automated System

docs.abstract: No need to donate buildings or pay bribes. At Boston University, Carleton, George Washington and Wesleyan, merely paying full tuition can offer a leg up.
docs.snippet: No need to donate buildings or pay bribes. At Boston University, Carleton, George Washington and Wesleyan, merely paying full tuition can offer a leg up.
docs.lead_paragraph: We’ve learned a lot this week about some of the advantages that rich people have in the college admissions process.

headline.main: Another Admissions Advantage for the Affluent: Just Pay Full Price
